result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan T Foley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jordan T Foley in court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan in court for Jordan T Foley.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer just received, counter offer made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 8/18/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.H.S. dob 12-16-2000 or RESIDENCE OR THEIR CHILD. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. MUST COMPLY WITH COUNSELING NOTED IN BOND MODIFICATION ON FILE.*

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan T Foley in court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan in court for Jordan T Foley. Victim in court and asks for contact. Bond amended to no contact with victims. Not guilty plea entered BY COUNSEL and trial reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court . Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 8/18/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.H.S. dob 12-16-2000 or RESIDENCE OR THEIR CHILD. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. MUST COMPLY WITH COUNSELING NOTED IN BOND MODIFICATION ON FILE.*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.H.S. dob 12-16-2000 or RESIDENCE OR THEIR CHILD. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Jordan T Foley in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for bond purposes only. Victim is present and makes statement. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
